summary: The Clean Air and Building Infrastructure Improvement Act (H.R. 4214) aims to amend the Clean Air Act regarding preconstruction permits related to national ambient air quality standards. The bill requires the EPA Administrator to concurrently publish regulations and guidance for implementing new or revised air quality standards. It specifies conditions under which a new standard will not apply to preconstruction permit applications and defines relevant terms. The bill also addresses the application of the 2024 Primary Annual Particulate Matter 2.5 Standard to such permits, outlining specific scenarios where it wouldn't apply.
